intro: Uragoga humilis, commonly known as the dwarf uragoga, is a small flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants like芋头 and philodendrons. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of small, white flowers on a spadix, typical of the arum family. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a glossy surface. Uragoga humilis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
